config.question: The Committee on Public Information was formed to __________.

choices.content: influence public opinion to support the war
ensure that the public had free access to impartial news about the war
encourage citizens to report on people suspected of disloyalty
contain the anti-German sentiment that was taking root among the public

answer_3.response: A week after war was declared, Wilson formed the Committee on Public Information (CPI) to mobilize support for the war, and asked George Creel, an outspoken progressive journalist, to head it. Creel worked out a system of voluntary censorship with the press, plastered walls with colorful posters, and issued more than 75 million pamphlets.
